title: Deaths duell, or, A consolation to the soule, against the dying life, and liuing death of the body Deliuered in a sermon at White Hall, before the Kings Maiesty, in the beginning of Lent, 1630. By that late learned and reuerend diuine, Iohn Donne, Dr. in Diuinity, & Deane of S. Pauls, London. Being his last sermon, and called by his Maiesties houshold the doctors owne funerall sermon.
author: Donne, John, 1572-1631.
publisher: Printed by Thomas Harper, for Richard Redmer and Beniamin Fisher, and are to be sold at the signe of the Talbot in Alders-gate street,
notes: The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A" in a border of ornaments; the second leaf bears an engraved portrait signed "Martin DR [monogram]". The portrait is sometimes not printed.
Variant: with an additional leaf of dedication from Richard Redmer to his sister, Mrs. Elizabeth Francis.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
